sense.name: main, numbered sections or subdivisions of a book
sense.examples: The exam will cover the first four chapters of the book. You can skip the chapters on coastal navigation, but not on basic sailing skills. The editor has received only two chapters so far of the famous author's new novel.

sense.name: a span of time usually characterized by identifying events
sense.commentary: CHAPTER[+quantity][+span][+temporal][+episode][+specific] Note: usually contains an identifying trait that was important to the referenced time span
sense.examples: It was a tragic chapter in Germany's history. This championship ends one of the greatest chapters in the ball club's history. Thus began a new chapter in our lives.

sense.name: a local branch of a club or society
sense.commentary: CHAPTER[+group][+organization][+society][+subset][+local] Note: always implies a local part of a larger society or club
sense.examples: She works for the local chapter of the American Cancer Society. Several chapters of the Delta Gamma Pi fraternity had low enrollment this year. He is a scout leader in the local chapter of the Boy Scouts.

sense.name: the governing body of a religious order or institution
sense.commentary: CHAPTER[+assembly][+governing][+institution][+religious] Note: always implies a ruling body within a religious organization
sense.examples: The chapter of monks met in the monastery's great hall. He was believed to have been in the chapter of the Knights of St. John during the 15th century.
